page.title: 07Holly Hill Park
page.content: Holly Hill Park,also known as {Winnards Copse}, is just off the A27 in Barnes Lane.There is a mansion, surrounded by gardens, which was built in 1910.When the owner died in 1977 {Fareham Borough Council}preserved it and changed it into an old peoples home. The{gardens}are very peaceful. There are many different kinds of plants and animals. The{woodland}contains mainly oak, sycamore and holly. The water areas have water birds like mallards, coots, moorhens, geese and many more. There are also water rats and fish. Most of the fish are golden carp. There are many quiet places to sit, the prettiest of which is beside the waterfalls. There are{picnic sites}and {car parks}which make it ideal for a day out.
